meanings.definition: To contract with another to perform a specific task or job.
meanings.sent1: The company subcontracted the cleaning services to a local janitorial company.
meanings.sent2: The construction company subcontracted the plumbing work to a specialized contractor.
meanings.sent3: The chef subcontracted the dessert making to a pastry chef, so he could focus on the main course.
meanings.sent4: She subcontracted the graphic design work to her talented friend, who added a creative touch to the project.
meanings.sent5: The manager subcontracted the event planning to an experienced team, ensuring a successful outcome.

meanings.definition: To hire another person or company to complete work that was originally contracted to oneself.
meanings.sent1: The small business owner subcontracted the website development to a professional web designer.
meanings.sent2: The homeowner subcontracted the roof repair to a local roofing company.
meanings.sent3: The farmer subcontracted the harvesting to a neighboring farm, allowing him to focus on planting crops.
meanings.sent4: She subcontracted the catering for the party to a renowned chef, ensuring a delicious meal for the guests.
meanings.sent5: The artist subcontracted the framing of her paintings to a skilled craftsman, enhancing their presentation.
